intro: Pourthiaea arguta var. hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is typical of the genus. The plant features slender, erect stems and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. This species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
